body_html:
Thanks for the reply. I tried setting intra_op_parallelism_threads=1, inter_op_parallelism_threads=1 but the same issue still happened. Now, I'm working on building a debug build to get gdb running.

Just to make sure what Derek is saying: so session creation is async and when it get to sess.run it blocks till it gets a response back from all the PSs? It would be great if you point me to this part of the code since I only have one PS so this should be easy to trace.

Just to make sure what Derek is saying: so session creation is async and when it get to sess.run it blocks till it gets a response back from all the PSs? It would be great if you point me to this part of the code since I only have one PS so this should be easy to trace.
body:
Thanks for the reply. I tried setting `intra_op_parallelism_threads=1, inter_op_parallelism_threads=1` but the same issue still happened. Now, I'm working on building a debug build to get gdb running. 

Just to make sure what Derek is saying: so session creation is async and when it get to `sess.run` it blocks till it gets a response back from all the PSs? It would be great if you point me to this part of the code since I only have one PS so this should be easy to trace.
